New Records: Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first player in MLB history to have at least 40 homers and 70 stolen bases in a single season
Key Match Events: Ronald Acuña Jr. singled to drive in the tying run with one out in the 10th inning, then stole his 70th base before scoring the winning run on Ozzie Albies’ walk-off single
Marcell Ozuna's ninth-inning homer tied the score again and forced extra innings
Post-Match Reflections: Ronald Acuña Jr. said, 'I’d be lying if I said to you that I thought I was going to get this done, that I was going to be able to do it.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was against the Chicago Cubs
